author: Filip Timotija
description: The killing of conservative activist Charlie Kirk this week in Utah has rocked the nation.  On Wednesday, Kirk, the co-founder of Turning Point USA, was speaking at an event at Utah Valley University in Orem, Utah, when he was shot and killed. After a manhunt, that involved local, state and federal law enforcement, authorities identified…
title: Sunday shows preview: Charlie Kirk assassination rocks nation

author: Lexi Lonas Cochran
description: Young conservatives and activists are determined to let the late Charlie Kirk’s principles guide their movement on college campuses and be more active than ever in honor of his memory.    The assassination of the founder of Turning Point USA, which has clubs on more than 850 campuses, has saddened but sharpened its followers and…
title: College conservatives vow to carry on Charlie Kirk’s work

author: Douglas MacKinnon, opinion contributor
description: Making Mamdani the foil and the face of the Democrats risks awakening millions of struggling Americans to the “free is for me” grift.
title: Republicans should be wary of making Mamdani the Democrat poster boy

author: Cheryl Kelley, opinion contributor
description: Today’s divisions feel unprecedented, but the nation has been here before — and survived far worse.
title: Will fear overtake America?

author: Jared Gans
description: Missouri Democrats see turning to the public as the best way to stop a new GOP-friendly congressional map from taking effect despite their minority status in the state legislature. Gov. Mike Kehoe (R) is poised to sign the new map into law for the 2026 midterms after the state Senate gave approval on Friday. The…
title: How Missouri Democrats could block the GOP’s new map

author: Mike Lillis
description: The assassination of Charlie Kirk has united the parties in a sense of dread that the country has arrived at a dangerous place. How it got here, however, remains very much in dispute. President Trump wasted no time blaming the “radical left” for the death of Kirk, a prominent MAGA activist. And a number of…
title: Parties agree that violence is a problem, but clash over the cause

author: Amie Parnes
description: Utah Gov. Spencer Cox (R) on Friday addressed a question both Republicans and Democrats were asking on the heels of conservative activist Charlie Kirk’s death: Will the tragic event finally mark a turning point? “This is our moment: Do we escalate or do we find an off-ramp?” an emotional Cox said at a news conference, where…
title: Utah governor Spencer Cox turns heads with Charlie Kirk address: ‘Choose a different path’
